heading: passage: jerry quarry, 53
subheading: he twice fought muhammad ali and lost two title shots, but jerry quarry's legacy may be a chilling reminder of his sport's brutality. the former heavyweight fighter died sunday at a templeton, california, hospital after a long descent into dementia brought on by repeated blows to the head. the progressive malady, similar to alzheimer's disease, left quarry virtually helpless and in the care of his family in his final years.
author: wired staff
